GO Pass Deluxe: Into the Wild
Earn additional rewards and unlock a Silver Bottle Cap at Rank 100!

Purchase GO Pass Deluxe: Into the Wild to unlock the following rewards! • One encounter with Shadow Darkrai • One Silver Bottle Cap, which can be used to max one stat—Attack, Defense, or HP—on any Pokémon via Hyper Training • And much more!
A special type of candy used to power up Pokémon beyond level 40. Catch a Pokémon to obtain your first!
Battle Trainers around the world to earn rewards and improve your battle knowledge.
Battle with other Trainers around the world.
Incubate Eggs to hatch Pokémon! Find Eggs at PokéStops or from opening a Gift.
Claim one a day and explore 1 km to hatch it and earn bonus XP!
Claim one a day and explore 1 km to hatch it and earn bonus XP.
Perfect timing, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve discovered a strange new type of Egg. I’ve never seen an Egg with this blue hue before.
I can feel heat radiating from inside after a quick walk around the lab, as if it’s almost ready to hatch! I suspect it doesn’t need to incubate as long as other Eggs.
I’ve set one up in this special Incubator. Take a walk and let’s see what kind of Pokémon it hatches. I’ll bet our resident Egg-thusiast Spark will be excited to hear about this one!

GO Pass Deluxe: Into the Wild + 10 Ranks
Dark, eh? We’ll try to keep things “light” and breezy then!
Ahem. Anyhow, Impidimp’s mischievous antics sure are fascinating, but maybe next time it can sneak into someone else’s lab.
Thanks again for recovering my notes from Impidimp, %PLAYERNAME%.
I’m eager to see what other brilliant feats you’ll achieve. Lead the way!
Oooh, it’s kind of spooky here...
But there’s no reason to be afraid of the Dark...type Pokémon!
Not that I need to tell you that. They’re taking to you like a shadow in late afternoon!
Why don’t you spend some more quality time with them and see what else we can learn?
Nice work! You’re the grimmest Trainer of them all. Er...in a good way!
This is a great time to brush up on your knowledge of Dark-type Pokémon. Do you remember their strengths and weaknesses?
Exactly! Dark types are strong against Psychic and Ghost types, but they’re weak to Fighting-, Bug-, and Fairy-type attacks.
Let’s put some of that theory into practice!
Not to be all doom and gloom, it looks like we’re not out of the woods yet.
Team GO Rocket is on the prowl—plus, Shadow Darkrai and Shadow Cresselia need help!
It’s a good thing you’re here to save the day, %PLAYERNAME%.
Team GO Rocket is itching for a fight, so let’s grant their wish!
Way to go, %PLAYERNAME%! I knew beyond a shadow of a doubt that you were going to succeed!
What started out as a search for my missing notes has turned into quite the adventure! But our tale doesn’t end here.
As you well know, there’s always more to see and learn.
I’m excited to see the next chapter unfold. Until next time, %PLAYERNAME%!
Impidimp’s mischievous antics sure are fascinating, but maybe next time it can sneak into someone else’s lab.
Thanks again for recovering my notes from Impidimp, %PLAYERNAME%.
And now for another enchanting experience—it’s time to research Fairy-type Pokémon! Lead the way!
These Fairy-type Pokémon are quite fantastical, aren’t they?
Maybe if we get into their good graces they can grant our wishes in secret. Now that’s fun to imagine!
What would you wish for? I’d want to switch bodies with Meltan for a day!
Anyway, let’s wander around some more and see what else we can learn.
Say, have you ever heard the story of the fairy prince who could attract Pokémon with the power of his music? Oh, you haven’t? Er, maybe I just made it up...
In any case, I may not be a fairy prince, but I do know a little about Fairy-type Pokémon that I can share!
They’re strong against Fighting-, Dragon-, and Dark-type Pokémon, but they’re weak to Poison and Steel types.
I wonder what other observations we might be able to make.
Keep your eyes peeled—we’re not out of the woods yet.
Team GO Rocket is on the prowl—plus, Shadow Darkrai and Shadow Cresselia need help!
It’s a good thing you’re here to save the day, %PLAYERNAME%.
Team GO Rocket’s itching for a fight, so let’s grant their wish!
Way to go, %PLAYERNAME%! You continue to impress.
What started out as a search for my missing notes has turned into quite the adventure! But our tale doesn’t end here.
As you well know, there’s always more to see and learn.
I’m excited to see the next chapter unfold. Until next time, %PLAYERNAME%!
Oh, where could they be?! Ah—%PLAYERNAME%!
You don’t happen to have seen my field notes anywhere, do you? It’s like they disappeared into thin air!
Sorry you have to see me in such a tizzy. I must’ve missed something...
Hm? Do you see something over there?
Aha! It looks like Impidimp, the Wily Pokémon, was behind my missing notes!
Impidimp like to sneak into people’s homes to steal things and feast on the negative energy of the frustrated occupants.
Oho, but look where Impidimp has led us! This place is rife with Fairy- and Dark-type Pokémon!
Feeling bold? Then let’s do some exploring!

Hello there, %PLAYERNAME%! I saw the most extraordinary thing today during my morning walk: a figure gliding across the lake’s surface too quickly to follow!
I suspect this mysterious figure must be Keldeo, the Colt Pokémon!
According to legend, Keldeo joined forces with Cobalion, Terrakion, and Virizion, who taught it the ways of battle.
This history might be why Keldeo seems to be looking for promising Trainers—Trainers like you! You should get out there and see if you can keep pace with it!
Hello again, %PLAYERNAME%! Still looking for Keldeo? You might be interested to know that in reviewing my research, I’ve found that this Pokémon has some truly extraordinary abilities.
By blasting water from its hooves, Keldeo can glide across any body of water, running over oceans and rivers to travel the world.
Quite remarkable! Who needs boats or planes with abilities like that?
If you’re fortunate enough to encounter Keldeo out there, act fast and don’t let your opportunity dash away—literally!
Welcome back, %PLAYERNAME%! As you’ve likely noticed, Keldeo has two types: Water and Fighting!
This rare and powerful combination makes Keldeo incredibly versatile in battle.
Few Pokémon can master both the fluid grace of water techniques and the raw intensity of fighting moves quite like it has.
Understanding their type advantages will be crucial in helping Keldeo reach its full potential. Now hoof it  and put this knowledge to good use!
You’re back, %PLAYERNAME%! Looking for more insights on Keldeo?
It’s been said that it dashes across the world as it seeks more opportunities to further its training.
I imagine an accomplished Trainer like you would catch its attention!
Keep up the exploration, %PLAYERNAME%. The more we understand Keldeo’s behavior, the better the chance we have of finding it!
There you are, %PLAYERNAME%! I’ve made a fascinating research discovery that I have to share with you!
Legends speak of a hidden power within Keldeo.
When Keldeo strengthens its resolve for battle, it fills its body with power and changes into its Resolute Form!
Keep getting out there, %PLAYERNAME%! If you’re fortunate enough to encounter Keldeo, you may be able to witness this transformation firsthand.
My latest observations suggest that Keldeo is nearby.
This could be your opportunity to finally encounter this Mythical Pokémon!
Make sure you’re ready, %PLAYERNAME%—something extraordinary could be right around the corner.
Excellent work as always, %PLAYERNAME%. I’m thrilled to see you’ve successfully befriended Keldeo.
Now that this exceptional Pokémon has joined your team, I must tell you more about its Resolute Form.
In Resolute Form, the power that lay hidden in its body covers its horn, turning it into a sword that can slice through anything.
And I’ve got a feeling that with your support, Keldeo will be ready to take that monumental step forward.
Fantastic work, %PLAYERNAME%! I think Keldeo is ready to change into its Resolute Form.
You’ve proven yourself to be the kind of Trainer Keldeo needs to reach its full potential.
The transformation you’re about to witness is a testament to your skill, your bond with Keldeo, and your commitment to helping this remarkable Pokémon grow.
Congratulations, %PLAYERNAME%! Now you’re a part of Keldeo’s legend, too!

You are too far away from this Pokéstop to contribute.

Poké Lids located across Japan appear as PokéStops in Pokémon GO. When you visit one and tap the Poké Lid’s PokéStop, you’ll receive a special Poké Lid stamp featuring a design unique to that region.

You can also enjoy this stamp rally with your friends! If you send a Gift from a Poké Lid PokéStop to a friend, they’ll also receive the stamp from that PokéStop for their Scrapbook.

Gather your friends and have fun collecting stamps together!

Stamps you get from Gifts will be collected in your Scrapbook, but they don’t count toward the reward track. Rewards can only be obtained when you visit the location and collect the stamps yourself.

Collect two stamps in any prefecture to encounter a Pikachu with a unique Location Background representing that prefecture.
You can see your progress with the reward track displayed for each prefecture.
This is a stamp rally where you visit Poké Lids installed across Japan.

Find the stamps all over Japan!
You can check the locations of the Poké Lids on the following website.

Hi there, %PLAYERNAME%! I’m glad our paths have crossed once again.
I’m on the way to research some Pokémon that have been appearing nearby, and I could use a hand!
Would you mind taking a quick detour to help me out?
I can’t wait to make some new discoveries together!
Excellent work, %PLAYERNAME%! I always treasure a chance to set off on an adventure with you!
Here’s a question. Have you ever thought about what makes exploring the world with your Pokémon precious for you?
Let’s try and track down the answer to that question together!
And who knows! Maybe we’ll both learn something new and unexpected about ourselves—or our Pokémon!

Purchase GO Pass Deluxe: November to unlock the following rewards! • One Super Incubator • One Lucky Trinket, which allows you to instantly become Lucky Friends with a friend of your choice • And much more!

Your friend has shared a stamp with you! Join the Poké Lid Stamp Rally and start collecting Pokémon stamps together!

A stamp rally is an activity where you collect stamps at certain PokéStops or Gyms. During the Poké Lid Stamp Rally, you can work with friends to collect those stamps even if you’re unable to visit in person.

You can view the stamps you collect on the stamp rally page in your Scrapbook.

In addition, certain stamp rallies let you send stamps to your friends along with a Gift. Stamps you get from Gifts will be collected in your Scrapbook, but they don’t count toward the reward track. Rewards can only be obtained when you visit the location and collect the stamps yourself.
You can view the stamps you collect on the stamp rally page in your Scrapbook.

Pokémon TCG: Mega Lucario ex Release Celebration
Included rewards: • Premium in-game items, such as a Premium Battle Pass, a Charged TM, and Rare Candy • Encounters with Pikipek with a Special Background • And more!

Included rewards: • Encounters with Paras, Stantler, Drampa, and Tarountula • 2 Incense • A Mossy Lure Module • 3 Lucky Eggs • And more! Paras and Stantler found in reward encounters for this research and all other research tasks are more likely to be Shiny!

Includes: • An encounter with Shiny Keldeo in its Ordinary Form • Shiny Keldeo T-Shirt avatar item • 25 Cobalion Candy, 25 Terrakion Candy, 25 Virizion Candy, 15 Snivy Candy, 15 Tepig Candy, 15 Oshawott Candy, 10 Darumaka Candy, and more • 10,352 XP and 6,470 Stardust • 3 Rare Candy XL and 6 Rare Candies for Trainers level 31 and up • 9 Rare Candies for Trainers level 30 and below • 90 Ultra Balls, 3 Unova Stones, 1 Max Mushroom, 1 Premium Battle Pass, 1 Lure Module, 1 Incense, and more!

Includes: • An encounter with Grimmsnarl, the Bulk Up Pokémon • Up to six free Raid Passes each day from spinning Photo Discs at Gyms • Increased chance of receiving event 5 km Eggs from spinning PokéStops • Up to six Special Trades per day and reduced Stardust cost for trades • 1/2 Hatch Distance for Eggs placed in Incubators • 2× Candy for catching Pokémon • A higher chance to encounter Shiny Pokémon during the event Learn more about the ticket bonuses here.
Includes: • Encounters with Dynamax Ralts and Dynamax Sableye • 1 Max Mushroom • 5 Premium Battle Passes • 4 Incubators • 2 Lucky Eggs • 2 Star Pieces • And more!

Included rewards: • Encounters with Emolga, Dedenne, Togedemaru, and Morpeko • 1 Magnetic Lure Module • 2 Premium Battle Passes • 1 Charged TM • 1 Elite Charged TM • 10,000 Stardust • And more! Your Friendship level will increase with each interaction, helping you unlock extra bonuses.

You can raise your Friendship level with a Trainer every day, and when you do so, that Trainer’s portrait will have a blue glow.

For a chance to become Lucky Friends with a Trainer, become Best Friends with them and continue interacting with them.

Trade with a Lucky Friend to receive a Lucky Pokémon! You can become Lucky Friends again later.
You started your first Remote Trade! You can check the trade status by coming back here. If your friend does not respond, the trade is canceled.
Good job! Next, your friend will review your trade. You can check the trade status by coming back here. If your friend does not respond, the trade is canceled.
Wow, you two must be excellent friends! You can now trade remotely with each other.
Remote Trades work slightly differently than normal trades. To start, tag Pokémon you’d like to trade with the Remote Trade tag.
You can see your friend’s tagged Pokémon and choose from them. They can also see and choose from yours.
Don’t worry, you’ll both review the chosen Pokémon before finalizing the trade. Have fun!

Play with your friends to become Forever Friends and unlock remote trading!

Once you’re Forever Friends, continue playing together to unlock more Remote Trades and other bonuses.
You can trade remotely and view the Pokémon your friend marked with the Remote Trade tag once you become Forever Friends.

At level 10, you can trade Pokémon with your friends. This can help complete your Pokédex!

You’ll need to be near a friend to trade with them. You can trade remotely with a friend once you become Forever Friends with them.
Now that you’ve reached level {0}, there are new challenges you’ll have to complete in order to progress to the next level.
Also like in local trading, you can earn a Candy bonus based on where the Pokémon were caught. The farther apart that they were caught—up to around 100 km—the more Candy you’ll get!
Some Pokémon may have these icons by their name.

Pokémon need some time before they are ready to be traded remotely.

This doesn’t apply to local trades.
Pokémon Not Ready for Remote Trade
You and your friend will each pick one of the requested Pokémon to offer. You both will review the chosen Pokémon before finalizing the trade.

Look through the Pokémon your friend has marked with the Remote Trade tag and choose one to three that you’d like.

Your friend will do the same with the Pokémon you tagged.
Choose Pokémon to Request from Your Friend

You are a few friendship points away from your first Forever Friend and unlocking your first Remote Trade!

To trade remotely, you need to use the Remote Trade tag to mark which Pokémon your friend can request.

Just like in local trading, the amount of Stardust needed for trading remotely varies. Certain trades require more Stardust.

Remote Trades don’t count towards Special Trades.
To make a Remote Trade, first you need to choose which Pokémon you are open to trading by tagging them with “Remote Trade.”
Tap and hold the icon of your friend’s Pokémon to learn more about it. If a Pokémon has a rare background, you can preview it.
Tap and hold the Pokémon to see details.
Pokémon with the Remote Trade tag can be seen by all Forever Friends, including details like when and where it was caught.
During Remote Trades, your friend can only choose from Pokémon that you’ve marked with the Remote Trade tag. You will review the chosen Pokémon before finalizing the trade.
How will this tag be used?
Tag Pokémon you are open to trading remotely with your Forever Friends. You will review any trades.
Find Pokémon you haven’t caught before.
Challenge will start once another Trainer is found.
Better rewards, easier to level up, and more levels.
Find and battle powerful Max Pokémon at Power Spots.
Join raids farther away on the map or via friend invites using a Remote Raid Pass.
